bug.short_desc: [abrt] backintime-common: snapshots.py:1754:_free_space:IndexError: list index out of range
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Version-Release number of selected component: backintime-common-1.1.12-2.fc25
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.8.0 cmdline: python3 /usr/share/backintime/common/backintime.py backup-job executable: /usr/share/backintime/common/backintime.py kernel: 4.8.1-1.fc25.x86_64 pkg_fingerprint: 4089 D8F2 FDB1 9C98 pkg_vendor: Fedora Project runlevel: N 5 type: Python3 uid: 14316
Truncated backtrace: snapshots.py:1754:_free_space:IndexError: list index out of range
Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/share/backintime/common/backintime.py", line 865, in <module> start_app() File "/usr/share/backintime/common/backintime.py", line 450, in start_app args.func(args) File "/usr/share/backintime/common/backintime.py", line 634, in backupJob backup(args, False) File "/usr/share/backintime/common/backintime.py", line 626, in backup ret = take_snapshot(cfg, force) File "/usr/share/backintime/common/backintime.py", line 70, in take_snapshot ret = snapshots.Snapshots( cfg ).take_snapshot( force ) File "/usr/share/backintime/common/snapshots.py", line 1059, in take_snapshot self._free_space( now ) File "/usr/share/backintime/common/snapshots.py", line 1754, in _free_space if last_snapshot is not snapshots[-1]: IndexError: list index out of range
Local variables in innermost frame: min_free_space: 1024 last_snapshot: '20161103-120004-197' keep_one_per_month: 12 self: <snapshots.Snapshots object at 0x7f529f9b0550> keep_all: 2 min_free_inodes: 2 smart_remove: True keep_one_per_day: 7 now: datetime.datetime(2016, 11, 3, 12, 0, 4, 501439) snapshots: [] old_backup_id: '20141101-000000-387' keep_one_per_week: 4

Can you reproduce this crash? What did you do to get the backtrace?
> Local variables in innermost frame: … > snapshots: []
Maybe you've manually deleted all of the snapshots from filesystem while backintime was running? Please use the GUI to remove obsolete snapshots.

(In reply to Raphael Groner from comment #3) > Can you reproduce this crash?
No.
> What did you do to get the backtrace?
It is an ABRT report of a crash that probably happened during the automatic backup.
> > Local variables in innermost frame: > … > > snapshots: [] > > Maybe you've manually deleted all of the snapshots from filesystem while > backintime was running?
I didn't.
